list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The castle is said to be haunted by a phantom.

list_ex_of_english: Daily checks by radiographers on the unit can be done quickly and easily with a cube phantom (which assumes the couch to be level).
It is not an implausible position on its own, but it seems to be in conflict with the case of paralyzed phantom limb patients.
Pitches that exceed the piano's tessitura hover, canopy-like, over the resonance: phantom pitches produced through the interaction of harmonics.
What if, instead of adding artificial connectivity between pairs of objects, a phantom object were introduced with which each real object was artificially connected?
Using a suitable phantom, it is possible to assess a number of standard image quality characteristics.
The "single white drop of blood" is a phantom sign, imagined and not empirically visible.
The interface is parameterized by an encoding, via phantom types, of the subtyping hierarchy.
The phantom includes a 'flood field' module for image uniformity assessment.
